image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Southern China construction site collapse: Search underway for 13 missing workers
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: French twist: Macronâ€™s premier ousted in no-trust vote. What's next
item.description: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier's government was ousted after a no-confidence vote spurred by a budget dispute. The far-right and left joined forces to oppose Barnier's proposed budget cuts and tax increases. President Macron now faces the challenge of appointing a new prime minister who can navigate a deeply divided parliament and address France's economic woes.

item.title: US President-elect Donald Trump nominates former congressman Billy Long as IRS commissioner
item.description: Former Missouri Congressman Billy Long has been nominated by President-elect Trump to lead the IRS, replacing current commissioner Daniel Werfel. This move comes amidst Republican opposition to the Biden administration's IRS funding increases. Long, known for his auctioneering background, will require Senate confirmation for the position.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Manhunt underway for killer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson after fatal shooting
item.description: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, 50, was shot and killed outside a Hilton hotel in Manhattan. A masked gunman fired repeatedly after an apparent gun malfunction, then fled on a Citi Bike. Police are investigating the incident, analyzing surveillance footage, and exploring potential motives, including workplace connections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden administration weighs preemptive pardons for Fauci, Schiff, and other ahead of Trump return
item.description: White House officials are debating preemptive pardons for individuals like Dr. Anthony Fauci, Adam Schiff, and Liz Cheney, anticipating potential prosecution under a returning Trump administration. This follows Trump's selection of Kash Patel as FBI lead and concerns about retribution against perceived critics. The discussions consider the implications of such pardons and the financial burdens of potential legal defenses.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: California school shooting: Two children hospitalised, suspected gunman dead
item.description: Two children were shot at Feather River School of Seventh-Day Adventists in Oroville, California, after a gunman opened fire on Wednesday. The shooter later died by suicide. The injured students were transported to hospitals, and their conditions remain unknown. Authorities believe the shooter had no connection to the school. Students were reunited with their families at a nearby church.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hamas threatens to 'neutralise' hostages if Israel launches rescue op
item.description: Hamas warned it would "neutralize" hostages if Israel attempts another rescue operation like the one in June at Gaza's Nuseirat camp. An internal Hamas statement revealed the group instructed operatives to enforce stricter conditions for captives and prepare for immediate action if Israel intervenes.

item.title: Iran Nobel peace winner released from prison for med treatment
UK MP tables bill in House classing Sikhs and Jews as ethnic groups
item.description: Labour MP Preet Kaur Gill introduced a bill in the UK House of Commons to classify Sikhs and Jews as ethnic groups for public service data collection. Gill highlighted the inadequacy of existing religious data and cited disproportionate impacts on these communities during the pandemic and in areas like homelessness and addiction.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: Meghan Markle accused of distancing from community by neighbours
item.description: Meghan Markle faces criticism from a Montecito neighbor for lack of community engagement, while Prince Harry receives mixed reviews for his local appearances and public work. The Sussexes' public image continues to be scrutinized, with accusations of orchestrated campaigns and complaints about Harry's memoir. Despite the negativity, Meghan expresses contentment with her family life.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pete Hegseth's mother defends him after accusing him of mistreating women
item.description: Pete Hegseth's mother defended him on Fox News against past accusations of mistreating women, claiming her previous email was written in haste. His nomination for defense secretary faces scrutiny over alleged sexual misconduct, financial mismanagement, and drinking habits. Despite the mounting allegations and potential replacement by Ron DeSantis, Hegseth continues to seek support from Republican senators.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: â€˜Not once did I suspectâ€¦â€™: Nicole Saphier defends Pete Hegseth
item.description: Fox News contributor Dr Nicole Saphier and other colleagues have defended Pete Hegseth against NBC News allegations of on-air intoxication. They deny witnessing any unprofessional behavior, while Hegseth's nomination for Secretary of Defense faces scrutiny amid these claims and reports of Trump considering Ron DeSantis for the position.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Power grid collapse plunges Cuba into darkness
item.description: Cuba plunged into darkness early Wednesday due to a failure at its largest power plant, Antonio Guiteras, marking the third major blackout in two months. The nationwide outage, attributed to aging infrastructure, follows recent hurricanes and dwindling fuel imports, exacerbating the island's economic crisis and sparking public frustration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: French lawmakers oust PM Michel Barnier in no-confidence vote
item.description: France's parliament ousted Prime Minister Barnier after just three months. Lawmakers voted no confidence in his government. This historic move followed Barnier's decision to bypass parliament on the budget. The far-right and left united against him. President Macron must now appoint a new prime minister. France faces political instability after June's inconclusive elections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: From Trade to Space: Trump's latest picks for key roles in his administration
item.description: Former President Donald Trump has announced a series of appointments for key positions in a prospective administration. His nominees include Peter Navarro for trade and manufacturing, Adam Boehler for hostage affairs, and Jared Isaacman for NASA administrator. Trump also tapped individuals for roles in the Treasury, Justice Department, SEC, State Department, and a newly envisioned Department of Government Efficiency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump taps legal expert David Warrington for White House Counsel role
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has appointed David A. Warrington as White House Counsel. Warrington, a veteran attorney and US Marine Corps veteran, has served as Trump's legal advisor and represented him in various capacities. He replaces Bill McGinley, who will lead the Department of Government Efficiency. Trump emphasized Warrington's legal expertise and commitment to conservative values.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Wife of slain UnitedHealthcare CEO reveals threats before targeted shooting
item.description: Brian Thompson, CEO of UnitedHealthcare's insurance division, was fatally shot outside a Manhattan hotel. His wife, Paulette, revealed he had received threats possibly related to his role, though details remain unclear. Police confirmed the attack was targeted and premeditated. A masked gunman fled the scene, and a $10,000 reward is offered for information.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Daniel Driscoll? Donald Trumpâ€™s pick for Secretary of Army
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump nominated Daniel P. Driscoll for Secretary of the Army. Driscoll, a veteran, venture capitalist, and former advisor to JD Vance, boasts a distinguished career including military service in Iraq and a law degree from Yale. Trump lauded Driscoll as a champion for soldiers and the America First agenda.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: In first public address, Hasina accuses Yunus of 'genocide', persecuting minorities 'especially Hindus'
item.description: Ousted Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina accused interim leader Muhammad Yunus of orchestrating genocide against minorities. Speaking from New York, she alleged targeted attacks on Hindus, Buddhists, and Christians, claiming Yunus's regime was responsible. Hasina also revealed a plot to assassinate her and her sister, forcing her August resignation to prevent further bloodshed.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Meet plaintiff in Supreme Court battle over gender-affirming care for trans minors
item.description: Memphis obstetrician-gynecologist Dr. Susan Lacy is challenging Tennessee's 2023 ban on gender-affirming care for minors. The Johns Hopkins graduate and founder of Modern Gynecology & Reproductive Health provides care for hundreds of transgender patients, advocating for their rights amidst restrictive legislation. Beyond her practice, Dr. Lacy is a community activist, serving on environmental and public health boards.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
